page.title: 05Shepway Cross
page.content: The{Shepway Cross}was built in 1923 for{Earl Beachamp.}The Cross is a memorial to a cross road. There is a plaque on the bottom which says:{'The {right honourable Sir Robert Menzies, {Lord Warden of the Cinque Ports, came {to this ancient site on the 6th of {August 1967 on his visit to Hythe'.}It also has written:{'To the glory of God {and in memory of the heroic deeds of {the Cinque Ports.'}On one side of the Cross is the virgin Mary holding Jesus. On the other side are two priests on either side of Jesus, who is being crucified.{Lympne Castle}is half a mile away. The area is mainly fields and trees. There is a shield on each side of the Cross.
